problem.p: The library is capable of awarding reduced credit based on the attempt number for the student. This problem demonstrates how it works.

For a student's first attempt, they can be awarded maximum credit (10/10). A student's second attempt will be awarded at most 9/10. Each attempt will decrease by 1, to a minimum of 1/10. When credit is decreased because of attempt-based partial credit, students receive a message informing them of this by default.
problem.script: from mitxgraders import * grader = StringGrader( attempt_based_credit=True, minimum_credit=0.1, # Note: Number between 0 and 1 decrease_credit_steps=9 )
problem.p: Note that attempt-based partial credit applies to all graders; this is just an example of using it with a StringGrader. It's also possible to set course-wide defaults to apply attempt-based partial credit to all your questions through the use of a plugin (which we provide a sample for).
We apologize that there is no mechanism by which you can reset your attempts for this question!
